q1.question: How can this be completely free?
q1.answer: LocalWrite runs entirely on your device using open source AI models. We have zero cloud costs - no servers, no bandwidth, no API fees. Our code is MIT licensed and open source.

q2.question: How good is the writing quality compared to ChatGPT?
q2.answer: LocalWrite uses state-of-the-art open source models like Qwen 2.5 7B and Gemma 2 9B. While cloud models may be larger, our local models provide excellent quality for writing enhancement, editing, and content generation. The critical advantage: your text never leaves your device.

q3.question: Does it work completely offline?
q3.answer: Yes! After the initial model download (2-6 GB per model, one-time), LocalWrite works 100% offline. Write on airplanes, in cafes without Wi-Fi, or anywhere without internet.

q4.question: Can I use this for commercial work?
q4.answer: Absolutely! LocalWrite is MIT licensed. Use it for personal projects, client work, commercial products, or anything else. No restrictions on commercial use.

q5.question: Which AI model should I choose?
q5.answer:
Qwen 2.5 7B (recommended) - Best all-around for essays, articles, and general writing.
Gemma 2 9B - Excellent for creative writing and storytelling.
Llama 3.1 8B - Great for professional, clean prose.
Llama 3.2 3B - Quick edits with low memory usage.
Mistral 7B - Balanced speed and quality.

q6.question: What are the system requirements?
q6.answer:
Minimum: macOS 11.0+, 8GB RAM, 2-6 GB storage per model
Recommended: 16GB RAM, Apple Silicon for faster processing
Technology: llama.cpp backend, GGUF models, Metal GPU acceleration
